intro: Stylesia puberula, commonly known as the silky stylesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish, and clustered in inflorescences. Stylesia puberula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
